marketNews.title: Adaro Group Performance Compilation 2024
marketNews.content: The Adaro Group announced its performance throughout 2024. Here are the details based on each issuer: Adaro Andalan Indonesia ($AADI) - AADI registered a net profit of US$1.21 billion during 2024 (+5.9% YoY). This result was slightly below our expectations (94.8% of Stockbit estimates), but in line with consensus expectations (98.3% of consensus estimates). A comparison of AADI's quarterly and annual performance in 4Q24 cannot be made because there is no performance data for 3Q24 as it was still consolidated within Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ADRO). The growth in AADI's net profit during 2024 was mainly driven by a ~30x increase in other income to US$339 million, in line with a US$322.9 million gain from the sale of its stake in Adaro Minerals Indonesia (ADMR). On the operational side, AADI's revenue declined -10.1% YoY during 2024 due to a decrease in average selling price (ASP) of -16.5% YoY, even though sales volume grew +7.4% YoY. On the cost side, the cost of goods sold in 2024 decreased by only -8% YoY, causing the gross profit margin to fall to 27.6% (vs. 2023: 29.2%). For 2025, AADI targets thermal coal sales volume of around 65-67 million tons, 1.6-4.5% lower YoY than the 2024 realization, with a stripping ratio of 4.3x (vs. 2024 realization: 4.4x). AADI itself allocates capex of around US$250-300 million during 2025. Alamtri Resources Indonesia ($ADRO) - ADRO registered a net profit of US$1.38 billion during 2024 (-15.9% YoY), in line with consensus expectations (102.5% of consensus estimates). A comparison of ADRO's quarterly and annual performance in 4Q24 cannot be made because there is no proforma performance data for 3Q24 that deconsolidates AADI. The weakening net profit was caused by a decrease in revenue from discontinued operations (-23.5% YoY) following the loss of control in AADI which was spun off in December 2024. For the 2024 fiscal year, ADRO still recognized revenue from AADI up to December 6, 2024. Excluding the profit from AADI, ADRO's net profit from continuing operations only fell by -2.4% YoY. Operationally, ADRO recorded a revenue decline of -2.7% YoY during 2024, mainly caused by a decrease in mining services segment revenue (-12.9% YoY). Meanwhile, on the cost side, an increase in operating expenses of +49.4% YoY during 2024 caused the operating profit margin to shrink to 35.3% (vs. 2023: 36.2%). Adaro Minerals Indonesia ($ADMR) - ADMR registered a net profit of US$105 million in 4Q24 (+25.8% QoQ, -45.1% YoY), resulting in a net profit for 2024 of US$437 million (-1% YoY) and slightly above consensus expectations (105% of consensus estimates). The quarterly net profit increase in 4Q24 was due to a revenue increase (+33.9% QoQ), supported by a volume increase of +50.8% QoQ amid a decrease in ASP of -11.2% QoQ. On the other hand, the surge in the cost of goods sold (+35% QoQ) and operating expenses (+69.5% QoQ) caused the operating profit margin to decrease to 41.5% in 4Q24 (vs. 3Q24: 42.7%). For 2025, ADMR targets metallurgical coal sales volume of around 5.6-6.1 million tons (vs. 2024 realization: 5.6 million tons), with a stripping ratio of 3.3x (vs. 2024 realization: 3.6x). ADMR allocates capex of around US$300-325 million during 2025 (vs. 2024 allocation: US$600-700 million). Key Takeaway: For 2025, besides being influenced by coal price fluctuations, Adaro group performance will also be affected by sales volume and stripping ratio. Based on guidance, we see AADI's performance potentially declining in line with lower sales targets than the 2024 realization amidst a stable stripping ratio target. Meanwhile, ADMR and ADRO's performance has the potential to remain stable or weaken slightly in line with potential sales volume increases amid the weakening trend of metallurgical coal prices.

marketNews.title: Delayed Indonesia Budget Report Has Investors Questioning Government Financial Condition
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the delay of the 2025 Monthly State Budget Report for the January 2025 period caused investors to question the government's financial condition. As of Wednesday (5/3), the government had not yet reported the State Budget balance as of January 2025, with the Ministry of Finance stating this was due to a busy schedule. The government usually holds a briefing regarding the State Budget position 2-3 weeks after the end of the preceding month. The January 2025 State Budget Report itself is highly anticipated, considering that in that month, President Prabowo Subianto issued instructions regarding budget efficiency for ministries/agencies amounting to 306.7 trillion rupiah.

marketNews.title: China Sets GDP Target at About 5% Despite US Tariffs
marketNews.content: Chinese Premier, Li Qiang, said on Wednesday (5/3) that the Chinese government is targeting economic growth of about +5% YoY in 2025, marking the same target for 3 consecutive years despite facing an escalation of the trade war with the US. This target is higher than consensus expectations which predicted growth of +4.5% YoY. The Chinese government also raised the fiscal deficit target from 3% of GDP in 2024 to 4% of GDP in 2025, in line with consensus expectations. Li pledged that the focus of China's economic policy will be directed towards increasing consumption, and hinted at loose monetary policy to stimulate domestic demand.

marketNews.title: US Secretary of Commerce Lutnick Considers Tariff Relief for USMCA Goods
marketNews.content: US Secretary of Commerce, Howard Lutnick, stated on Tuesday (4/3) that the US government may announce tariff relief for goods from Mexico and Canada covered under the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) free trade agreement. This trade pact was previously negotiated by the administration of US President Donald Trump during his first term. Lutnick mentioned that the US government will not eliminate import tariffs for Canada and Mexico, but might slightly adjust the tariff amounts, with a decision expected on Wednesday (5/3). Lutnick's statement came after the US officially implemented import tariffs of 25% for Canada and Mexico, with an exemption for energy imports from Canada which were only subject to a 10% tariff.

marketNews.title: Myanmar's Wa State Signals Tin Mine Reopening, But Full Supply Recovery Faces Delays
marketNews.content: The International Tin Association reported that the authorities of Wa State in Myanmar have indicated their readiness to accept applications for mining and processing permits at the Man Maw tin mine, signaling that the mine might reopen later this year since it was suspended in August 2023. Myanmar is the world's third-largest tin producer after China and Indonesia, and the Man Maw mine—before its suspension—was the largest tin producer in the country. Nevertheless, metal columnist at Reuters, Andy Home, explained that the announcement from the Wa State authorities is only the first step toward fully reopening the Man Maw mine, considering it will take at least several months for workers—especially from China—to obtain work permits and relocate back to Myanmar, even after mining permits are granted. Home also argued that the return of the Man Maw mine will not immediately solve the global tin supply issue, given that one large tin mine in Congo is experiencing increased risk from local rebels.

marketNews.title: Global Natural Rubber Shortfall Looms in 2025 Due to Stagnant Output
marketNews.content: Senior Economist at the Association of Natural Rubber Producing Countries (ANRPC), Lekshmi Nair, told Reuters that global natural rubber production in 2025 will still be lower than consumption growth, marking a supply deficit for the 5th consecutive year. According to ANRPC, global natural rubber production in 2025 is expected to grow by only +0.3% YoY to 14.9 million tons, while demand is projected to grow +1.8% YoY to 15.6 million tons. Specifically for Indonesia, ANRPC forecasts natural rubber production in Indonesia in 2025 to fall by -9.8% YoY to 2.04 million tons. Nair explained that the current global shortage of natural rubber is caused by low replanting efforts due to low prices over the last 7-8 years, before natural rubber prices reached a 13-year high at the end of 2024.

marketNews.title: Director of PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat (BJBR) Resigns Amid Corruption Investigation
marketNews.content: The President Director of PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat ($BJBR), Yuddy Renaldi, submitted his resignation letter citing personal reasons. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on April 16, 2025. Previously, the KPK (Corruption Eradication Commission) was conducting an investigation into alleged corruption in BJBR's advertising procurement for the 2021-2023 period.

marketNews.title: Indo Kordsa (BRAM) Production Halted Due to Flooding Force Majeure
marketNews.content: Indo Kordsa ($BRAM) announced that all of the company's production activities were forced to halt temporarily due to force majeure caused by flooding in the factory area located in Citeureup, Bogor Regency. BRAM stated that the impact of the force majeure is not yet clear, but the company is undertaking cleanup and facility repairs to restore operational activities as soon as possible.

marketNews.title: Anindya Bakrie Leaks Latest Plans for Bakrie Group, Affecting VKTR and ENRG Shares
marketNews.content: The President Director of Bakrie & Brothers ($BNBR) and President Commissioner of VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas ($VKTR), Anindya Bakrie, stated that the Bakrie group is currently reviewing potential share buybacks, although he did not specify which company would undertake the corporate action. Besides BNBR and VKTR, issuers under the Bakrie group include Energi Mega Persada ($ENRG), Bumi Resources ($BUMI), and Bumi Resources Minerals ($BRMS).

tickerNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu Purchases 1.3 Million BREN Shares
tickerNews.content: $BREN: Prajogo Pangestu, the controller of Barito Renewables Energy, purchased 1.3 million BREN shares at an average price of 6,077 rupiah per share on March 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 7.9 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Prajogo Pangestu's ownership in BREN increased from 0.09896% to 0.09993%.

tickerNews.title: Bank Mandiri (BMRI) Plans to Issue Sustainable Environmental Bonds up to IDR 5 Trillion with 370-Day and 3-Year Tenors
tickerNews.content: $BMRI: Bank Mandiri plans to issue sustainable environmental bonds up to 5 trillion rupiah, with the proceeds intended to finance and/or refinance environmentally friendly business activities. The bonds, which received an idAAA rating from Pefindo, consist of 370-day and 3-year tenors, with respective interest rates of 6.35% and 6.65%. The public offering period is estimated to run from March 18-20, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) Explains Share Price Decline Due to Macroeconomic Conditions and Asset Quality Deterioration
tickerNews.content: $BBRI: Bank Rakyat Indonesia explained to the IDX that the decline in the company's share price over the last 1 year was caused by several factors, namely: 1) macroeconomic conditions pressuring the company's main market, which is the middle-low income segment; and 2) a decline in asset quality, indicated for example by an increase in the cost of credit. BBRI stated it will continuously implement various improvements and anticipatory measures in loan underwriting, key performance indicators (KPI), and portfolio management to ensure quality growth and optimal profitability.

tickerNews.title: Japfa Comfeed Indonesia (JPFA) Plans Share Buyback Up to 2% of Shares with Maximum IDR 470 Billion Allocation
tickerNews.content: $JPFA: Japfa Comfeed Indonesia plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 234.5 million (2%) shares with a maximum fund allocation of 470 billion rupiah. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on April 10, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Eralink International Increases Shareholding in Erajaya Swasembada (ERAA) to 54.93%
tickerNews.content: $ERAA: Erajaya Swasembada's controller, PT Eralink International, purchased 65.9 million ERAA shares at an average price of 364 rupiah per share on February 28, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 24 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Eralink International's ownership in ERAA increased from 54.51% to 54.93%.

tickerNews.title: Matahari Department Store (LPPF) Plans Share Buyback Up to 10% with Maximum IDR 150 Billion Allocation
tickerNews.content: $LPPF: Matahari Department Store plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 10% of its shares with a maximum fund allocation of 150 billion rupiah. This plan will be discussed at the AGM on April 10, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bain Capital Credit Member LLC Acquires 10.5% Stake in Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya (SRAJ)
tickerNews.content: $SRAJ: Bain Capital Credit Member LLC announced the purchase of 1.3 billion Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya shares at an average price of 636 rupiah per share on February 26-28, 2025, bringing the total transaction value to approximately 817 billion rupiah. The transaction included a subscription of 238 million new shares through private placement at an average price of 2,200 rupiah per share and the purchase of 1.05 billion shares from SRAJ's controller, PT Surya Cipta Inti Cemerlang, at an average price of 280 rupiah per share. Following this transaction, Bain Capital Credit Member LLC's ownership in SRAJ increased from none previously to 10.5%, while PT Surya Cipta Inti Cemerlang's ownership decreased from 58.82% to 50.27%.

tickerNews.title: PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat (BJBR) President Director Resigns Amid Corruption Probe
tickerNews.content: The President Director of PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat ($BJBR), Yuddy Renaldi, submitted his resignation letter citing personal reasons. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on April 16, 2025. Previously, the KPK was conducting an investigation into alleged corruption in BJBR's advertising procurement for the 2021-2023 period.

tickerNews.title: Indo Kordsa (BRAM) Production Halted Temporarily Due to Flood Force Majeure in Bogor
tickerNews.content: Indo Kordsa ($BRAM) announced that all of the company's production activities were forced to halt temporarily due to force majeure caused by flooding in the factory area located in Citeureup, Bogor Regency. BRAM stated that the impact of the force majeure is not yet clear, but the company is undertaking cleanup and facility repairs to restore operational activities as soon as possible.

tickerNews.title: Anindya Bakrie Hints at Potential Share Buybacks Across Bakrie Group, Including VKTR and ENRG
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Bakrie & Brothers ($BNBR) and President Commissioner of VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas ($VKTR), Anindya Bakrie, stated that the Bakrie group is currently reviewing potential share buybacks, although he did not specify which company would undertake the corporate action. Besides BNBR and VKTR, issuers under the Bakrie group include Energi Mega Persada ($ENRG), Bumi Resources ($BUMI), and Bumi Resources Minerals ($BRMS).
